fields.description:
It should be possible to put a project into a 'held' state, where nothing can be done to it, or a 'hidden' state so it does not show up in the non-admin web interface.

I'm sure other states would be useful to others too.

As per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1450 which was opened 17 years ago, this needs to be available to all paying users, not just premium.
fields.summary: Project status - archive project

fields.description: Currently when you add a screen to a transition the screen uses the old editor, it would be good to be able to use the new editor also in a transition screen.
fields.summary: Be able to use the new editor in a transition screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a User custom field value to grant the Create Issue permission, the user cannot create sub-tasks in the new issue view. Jira displays the following error message:

!Screen Shot 2020-07-15 at 16.53.27.png|width=416,height=189!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user picker custom field and add it to the create/edit/view screen of a software/SD project.
 # Grant the Create Issue permission to a User custom field value and choose the field created.
 # Go to an issue and pick a user using the field created (the user must not have this permission via a group/project role)
 # Ask the user to try to create a sub-task using the new issue view.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to create the sub-task.
h3. Actual Results

Jira displays the following error message and doesn't create the sub-task:
{noformat}
We couldn't create the sub-task
Check your connection, then give it another try{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Use the old issue view to create sub-tasks

OR

add this user to a group/project role that has the create issue permission in the project
fields.summary: Using a user picker custom field to grant the Create Issue permission doesn't allow users to create sub-tasks in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The user seeing a blank page when accessing Project Settings on Business projects.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a business project in Jira.
# Then go to Project list - https://yoursitename/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa
# Find for the business project you created in step 1 
# Click on the eclipse button > Project settings

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to see project settings for the business project

h3. Actual Results

User sees blank/white page

h3. Workaround

# Go to the project list
# Click on the project name > Project settings
fields.summary: Can't access Project Settings from the Browse Projects list

fields.description:
{panel}
h3. As of 19-Aug-2020, this issue is now fixed. 
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Some apps need to perform post installation tasks which are dependent on user searches such as /rest/api/3/user/search. These searches return no results immediately after the installation of the app.

For context, also see [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/empty-users-and-projects-from-rest-api-for-just-installed-app/39753].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an app that performs a user search immediately after receiving the app enabled event.
 # Observe the returned results.

h3. Expected Results

The search returns results.
h3. Actual Results

The search results are empty for a period after the app was installed. Subsequent identical searches return results after a sufficient period of time has passed.
h3. Workaround

Re-try until search results are obtained.
fields.summary: Empty user search results immediately following app installation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we open the project settings and select issues and filters, if we select a filter with 2+ issues, the first issue will display the "*Link Confluence page*" option, for all other issues the option will be missing.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new project.
 # Create two issues on this project.
 # Select "Issues and filters".
 # Select the first issue.
 # Select the dropdown button to expand the link issues options.
 # The *Link Confluence page* is there.
 # Select the second issue.
 # Select the dropdown button to expand the link issues options.
 # The *Link Confluence page* is missing, we can only see *Add web link*.

h3. Expected Results
The dropdown button to expand the link issues options should display *Link Confluence page* to all issues.

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown button to expand the link issues options only display *Link Confluence page* for the first issue.

h3. Workaround
# Open the issue in the full issue view.
OR
# Disable the new Jira issue view, this issue is not reproducible with the old Jira issue view.
fields.summary: Link Confluence page option is missing when browsing issues from an issue search.

fields.description: There is no option to hide or display custom fields based on the status, it would be helpful to add a workflow condition that hide/unhide custom fields based on the status or status ctaegory.
fields.summary: Hide/unhide custom fields based on the status

fields.description:
Using StatusCategory is a less brittle approach to many Status-based configuration scenarios. This would allow future workflow Status additions to operate properly without having to revisit prior configurations.

That enhancement would help admins to create configurations that are less subject to breaking as new Status values are added to an instance

Example: When adding conditions that involves statuses could be difficult to identify which statuses need to be used if there are too many of them, using status category could be selected to use all the done/green statuses in a single click.
fields.summary: Allow StatusCategory to be used instead of specific Status values in workflow configurations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Formats used in create issue screen for description field is different from edit issue screen. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and description field will not take the formatting specified. Eg : 
|*Checklist story/bug FIM*| *test* |

 # Edit the same issue and update the description field it will use the formatting specified.

h3. Expected Results

!image-2020-07-14-21-57-59-994.png|width=414,height=353!
h3. Actual Results
h3. !image-2020-07-14-21-58-27-115.png|width=306,height=284!

Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Need same formatting on create and edit screen for description field

fields.description: It would be great if we could choose the columns included in issue filter subscription email notifications. Jira currently defaults to the columns selected in the issue detail view.
fields.summary: Allow user to select columns to be included in Jira filter subscription emails

fields.description:
Currently when dragging / dropping tickets into a Fix Version on the Backlog view of the Boards, it will always move tickets to the dropped Fix Version. This is an annoyance for tickets with existing Fix Versions because they are always replaced with the dropped Fix Version. For any tickets with an existing Fix Version, it would be great if we could get a prompt asking what we would like to do with the tickets that already have a Fix Version. For example, asking the user if they would like to Add to existing, or replace existing Fix Versions. This functionality is already available in the bulk update wizard for Fix Versions.

Hopeful that you consider this request. Thank you!
fields.summary: Prompt user on Backlog tab of the Boards when updating Fix Versions on tickets with existing Fix Versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a user with multi-language teams, I would like that Jira could translate the content of fields such as comments, description, and summary. 

The idea is that the field displays the content translated depending on the user country/timezone.
fields.summary: Ability to translate fields content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Archive project functionality was released recently for our premium customers in cloud. However, the Jira admins cannot archive those projects for which they do not have Browse project permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the Projects page, select a Project for which you don't have "Browse project" permission.
# Click on three dots (...) and choose "Archive".
 
h3. Expected Results
Should Archive the project

h3. Actual Results
{panel}
*Something went wrong*
We couldn’t archive the 'Project Atlassian' project.
Try again.
{panel}

h3. Workaround
The Jira admin should grant himself Browse project permission and then Archive works.
fields.summary: Cannot Archive project for which the admin does not have Browse project permission.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Slack connection suddenly disappears from the Project app configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate JIRA with Slack.
# Based on which project integrate with slack , the connection will display at the App configuration.
# Leave the configuration

h3. Expected Results
Slack connection should remain at the configuration unless someone removed it.

h3. Actual Results
After sometimes, the connection disappear.

h3. Workaround
iInitiate the connection again from the Slack side by typing
{noformat}
/jira connect
{noformat}
fields.summary: Slack connection suddenly disappear from the Project app conifguration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
[Find users assignable to projects|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-user-search/#api-rest-api-3-user-assignable-multiprojectsearch-get] not working as expected in some cases.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create project AA of type "Next-gen software"
2. Create project BB of type "Business Project"
3. Send GET request with 
/rest/api/2/user/assignable/multiProjectSearch?projectKeys=AA,BB

h3. Expected Results
Returns a list of users who can be assigned issues in both AA and BB projects. 

h3. Actual Results
The result was empty.

h3. Additional Details
The REST endpoint is not working only when we include one or more next-gen and business project keys in the *projectKeys* parameter.

It is working fine in the call is made with keys from any other project type combination.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Find users assignable to projects REST endpoint not working as expected

fields.description:
It's not currently possible to remove or hide the web links panel from the new issue view. For issues with a large number of web or external links, this clutters the issue view. In the old issue view, there was at least the ability to collapse the web links panel which would persist through page refresh.

!image-2020-07-13-19-04-51-902.png!

It would be useful to be able to either collapse the web links section or otherwise hide it from the issue view by configuring the issue layout.
fields.summary: Ability to hide or collapse the web links panel in the new issue view

fields.description: Add the possibility to create or add buttons to the existing ones on the issue view which can be configured for different use cases or additional options.
fields.summary: Add buttons on the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When having date field empty in Jira, opening them in the VSCode plugin, dates are set to 2/18/1993.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in Jira and have at least one date field empty;
 # Open the issue in VSCode having the integration properly configured;

h3. Expected Results
For empty date custom fields, the dates will appear empty as well in VSCode.

h3. Actual Results
For empty date custom fields, the dates appear to a default of 2/18/1993.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Empty dates are being set to 2/18/1993 in Jira fields on the VSCode integration

fields.description:
Problem  - AP.context.getContext() called from webpanel located at "atl.jira.view.issue.right.context" returns context for old issue

Steps - Steps to reproduce (100%, every time)
* Create Jira project with "Bug Tracking" template, and create 2 tasks there
* Go to personal Jira settings and enable "New Jira issue view" (old issue view works correctly)
* Select first task, getContext returns correct key (DBT-1 on video)
* Select second tasks, getContext returns corect key (DBT-2)
* Select first task again, getContext still returns DBT-2, it should return DBT-1 because we are viewing DBT-1.
fields.summary: AP.context.getContext() returns old values in atl.jira.view.issue.right.context

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Issue assigned* trigger in your rule, the trigger is also applicable when clearing the *Assignee* field or unassigning an Issue which is contradictive because the Issue is not being assigned but the exact opposite.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule using the *Issue assigned* trigger
 # Unassign any Issue with an assignee

h3. Expected Results

The rule should not be triggered since you are "unassigning" and not "assigning"

h3. Actual Results

The rule is triggered either way because it's not actually looking at Issues being assigned but in reality, it's simply looking at the *Assignee* field being updated.

h3. Workaround

Add a condition that checks if the *Assignee* field is empty or not.
fields.summary: Issue assigned trigger works when Unassigning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When clicking the subtask link from the parent issue, the subtask does not open in a new tab

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Create a subtask for 1
# In 1, click the link to 2 shown in the "Subtask" field

h3. Expected Results
2 opens in a new window

h3. Actual Results
2 opens in the same window 

h3.Workaround
Use the context menu to open the link in a new tab
fields.summary: When clicking the subtask link from the parent issue, the subtask does not open in a new tab

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The "Default issue type" dropdown is only honoured when the user has not previously selected an issue type, so only works once after logging in.

It'd be useful to have a hard default that is always used with every new issue created.

The current functionality should be retained and be the default configuration, to avoid backwards compatibility problems and to avoid making one group happy at a loss to another.
h3. Suggested solution
 # Add a new checkbox underneath the "Default issue type" dropdown with the label: "Re-use the previously selected issue type"
 # New checkbox checked by default to retain current functionality and BC

h3. Outcome
 * When checkbox is checked (and previously chosen issue type exists)

 ** The user's previously chosen issue type will be used
 ** Current functionality retained
 ** Backwards compatible
 * When checkbox not checked (or previously chosen issue type doesn't exist)

 ** The "Default issue type" will be used
 ** New functionality gained for users wanting it
 ** The "Default issue type" wording is now a bit more accurate/meaningful
fields.summary: Default issue type additional option to not use session (last used)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to open a Sub-Task in the side-bar from inside a parent issue nothing happens. The card is clickable and yet nothing happens. Clicking on the issue key specifically will open the sub-task in a full view, instead of the sidebar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Story and a Sub-Task inside it;
# Try to open the sub-task by clicking on the card area instead of the issue key.

Video:  [^sub-task-side-bar.mov] 

h3. Expected Results

The sidebar will be updated with the Sub-Task information.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround

Click on the sub-task key, which will open the information in a full window.
fields.summary: When trying to open a Sub-Task in the side-bar from inside a parent issue nothing happens

fields.description:
Currently, as we know that the Archive feature comes with Premium or Enterprise offering, the Archive feature tab is available for all the cloud sites as shown in the screenshot adding to some confusion since they can't Archive the projects.

It would be great if the tab is only shown when -

- The customer has currently subscribed for Premium license
- The customer had Premium license and later moved to Standard plan while having some projects in Archive.
fields.summary: Additional checks while displaying Archive feature tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Grant "Administer Project" permission to "User custom field value (XXXX)" makes project setting/archive/trash options visible to all users

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Go to the permission scheme > provide "Administer Project" permission to "User custom field value (XXXX)" >  project setting/archive/trash options visible to all users here: https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/projects

h3. Expected Results
Project setting/archive/trash options should not visible to all users here: https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/projects

h3. Actual Results
Project setting/archive/trash options are visible to all users here: https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/projects



h3. Workaround
Remove the  "User custom field value (XXXX)" in the Administer project permission
fields.summary: Grant "Administer Project" permission to "User custom field value (XXXX)" makes project setting/archive/trash options visible to all users

fields.description:
In the new issue view, if you click in the assignee or reporter fields but don't type any character, a list of users is displayed to you, however, this does not work for User picker custom fields. 

To display any suggestions in user picker custom fields, you must type a character. It would be great if it worked as the Assignee or Reporter fields, where suggestions are provided even if no text is entered.
fields.summary: Allow suggested options to appear in user picker custom fields when no text is entered

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing a test, if you press enter it adds a paragraph between the lines, causing the text to have a huge space between the lines.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create an issue
* Using the new issue view, type something at the description and hit enter and type something again
* Save the change
* Observe the space between the lines

h3. Expected Results

Jira editor should not separate each line by paragraph.

h3. Actual Results

if you press enter it adds a paragraph between the lines

h3. Workaround

When typing, use shift+enter to add hardbreaks.
fields.summary: Paragraph margins are too large

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add a prompt, pop-up, or warning that Enabling/Disabling Outgoing Mail will affect entire project (*all members)* or *only your account*? Even with admin permissions? This is a relatively large impact action with a simple switch than can be accidentally activated if user only wants to stop outgoing mail from their personal account. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: System - Outgoing Mail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

When we click on subtask under the parent, it will not redirect to the subtask instead it will be a erroneous click.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step 1 : Open the story/task

Step 2 : click on the subtask it will not redirect for the first time.

Step 3 : Clicking on the issue key will redirect.

Step 4 : Now, go back to the parent and click on the subtask again (anywhere) it will redirect.

 
h3. Expected Results

Even without clicking on the issue key of the sub-task the issue should be redirected.
h3. Actual Results

 Video explaining the same :  ...

[^subtask access issue.mp4]

!image-2020-07-09-20-08-29-947.png|width=343,height=240!!image-2020-07-09-20-08-39-970.png|width=272,height=159!
h3. Workaround

Click on the issue key of the subtask
fields.summary: click on subtask under the parent, it will not redirect to the subtask

fields.description: In Jira, when the sidebar is collapsed there is additional padding for the sidebar. If the sidebar is not collapsed, the page occupies full width and doesn't show additional padding.
fields.summary: When Jira sidebar is collapsed, there is additional padding

fields.description:
h4. Problem

Attempting to JQL search for cascading select values results in an error like:
{code:java}
An option provided by the function 'cascadeOption' for the field 'testcascadefield' does not exist.

{code}
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 * Have a cascading select field (i.e. testcascadefield) with at least 2 defined contexts. Let's call them ContextA and ContextBC
 ** ContextA is configured for ProjectA
 ** ContextB is configured for 2 projects: ProjectB and ProjectC
 * Now configure the value options of ContextA and ContextB to have overlap
 ** For example, let's say both allows for selecting the value "foobar"
 * Ensure that your account *does not* have "Browse" permissions to ProjectB and ProjectC
 ** This is the key trigger of the bug
 * Now running the JQL:
{code:java}
testcascadefield in cascadeOption("foobar")

{code}

 * We get the error:
{code:java}
An option provided by the function 'cascadeOption' for the field 'testcascadefield' does not exist.
{code}

 * Now, if we grant the user account to either "Browse" permissions to either ProjectB or ProjectC, the error does not occur.

So the problem occurs on 2 conditions:
# if there is a context containing no projects that the user account can see
** As long as there's at least 1 project in the context viewable to the user, then the error does not occur.
# if there is a option in the context that is the same value as another context

h4. Expected Behaviour
If an user does not have access to projects defined within a field's context, this should not affect the results for contexts that the user does have proper access to

h4. Actual Behaviour
No issues are returned and the user is instead presented with an error

h4. Workaround
# Avoid using the function. "cascadeOption".  So from the above example, use this instead:
{code}
testcascadefield in ("foobar")
{code}
# Or check each context to ensure that the user has access to at least one of the projects listed
# Or avoid having multiple contexts with the same option values
fields.summary: An option provided by the function 'cascadeOption' for the field does not exist

fields.description:
As Jira admin whose project switched their working method
I want to have seperate reporting from before and after the new method
So that, on a longer term and automatically updated, we can compare our results.

Example:
Compare all issue types from sprint < 30 to >= 30.

Every new sprint, the new issue types will be added to my dashboard reporting.
fields.summary: Support "bigger than" while filtering Sprint numbers

fields.description:
When assigning an issue the entry box does not recognise the assignee's email address. Sometimes, one person may have the same display name with different Atlassian accounts. So, it makes sense to have the ability to choose based on email addresses.
 !2020-07-09_11-11-22.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to choose assignee of issue using email address

fields.description:
As an automation rule author

I want to edit the trigger for a rule

So I can rapidly implement rules which need a new trigger

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * When creating a new rule, the trigger may be changed after selection
 * When editing an existing rule, the trigger may be changed after selection
 * After a trigger is changed, the editor quickly identifies problems that must be corrected (For example, accessing smart values which are no longer available due to the trigger change.)
 * Bonus: when a trigger is changed, the editor graphically highlights problems that must be corrected, drawing the author's attention
 * Big Bonus: adding a trigger of another rule completing execution could reduce the need to edit triggers for a chain of rules

 

Business case:

When creating complex rules, authors may discover during testing that the trigger is incorrect, or incomplete, to meet their needs.  Their only option is to recreate the rule from scratch.  Having the ability to edit the trigger would allow faster prototyping and reuse of rules, as existing rules could be copied and adjusted for new trigger conditions.
fields.summary: Ability to edit automation rule trigger

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to use JQL advanced search to filter issues that are linked to other issues but only show results where the linked issues are not in closed or resolved status.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Performing a JQL using issueLinkType = "is blocked by", for example, returns all issues that are or were blocked by issues even if the blockers are resolved or done.

h3. Expected Results

Having a function or a modifier that filters the results further so that only links to "active" issues are considered.
h3. Actual Results

There's no way to perform this filter in a single query at the time.
h3. Workaround

Retrieving all "active" issues (not resolved or closed) manually and using them to form a query like the following example:

{code:sql}
project = "EOB" AND issue in linkedIssues(EOB-1,"blocks") OR issue in linkedIssues(EOB-3,"blocks") OR issue in linkedIssues(EOB-4,"blocks")
{code}


This works but becomes impractical as the number of "active" issues increases
fields.summary: JQL - Filter issues that are linked only to open/active issues (not resolved or closed blockers)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you try to access the *Jira Concepts - Issues* page as follows _<instance>/secure/ShowConstantsHelp.jspa_ you can't see the icons associated to Issues Types, Resolutions, Statuses, etc anymore. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access <instance>/secure/ShowConstantsHelp.jspa

h3. Expected Results
 !Expected.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 !Actual.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: ShowConstantsHelp.jspa no longer displays information correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Need to better handle the error reported when you try to hover over the Reporter of an issue and the reporter is removed from the instance:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create an issue
2. Assign to a user
3. Remove the user from the instance.
4. Hover over the assignee in issue-view, you see an error.

h3. Expected Results
A message suggesting that the user's information can no longer be viewed as the user is removed from the instance

h3. Actual Results
{quote}
*Oops, looks like we're having issues*
Try again and we'll give it another shot
{quote}
 
h3. Notes
This behavior is different for a portal only customer account. Where after removing the customer from the instance, you do have an option to view their reported issues on the instance.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Need to better handle error reported when you try to hover over the Reporter of an issue and the reporter is removed from the instance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Tenant created JSW projects and associated with *same permission scheme*
 # Trashed one JSW project
 # Downgraded plan to FREE

Discussed in slack https://atlassian.slack.com/archives/CSBJ73LMT/p1593690699221500
h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results

Current :  *No changes in permission scheme* 

If the _same permission scheme is associated with a *JSD project*_ then permission scheme is getting *downgraded*.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Downgrading free plan is not updating permission scheme if tenant is having only JSW projects. But it downgrades if same scheme is associated with JSD and JSW projects.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Advanced Search list view with a link to video files autoplay when you have the column where the video link is added
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a link to a video on the Description field of an issue
 # Go to Advanced Search and search for the issue
 # Change to Lits View and make sure to add the Description field to the column, it will show the link and you can also hear the audio from it.
h3. Expected Results

Only view the links with no autoplay
h3. Actual Results

The link to the videos autoplay the audio
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Advanced Search list view with link to video files autoplays the audio

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cancel action on the *Issue Type Screen Scheme Association* returns the error: 
 * *No project could be found with key 'screens'.*

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Start on the main page of any Project in Jira.
 2) Click on "Project Settings" in the left navbar.
 3) Select "Screen" in the left navbar.
 4) Under "Actions" select "Use a different scheme".
 5) Click "Cancel".
 6) Error: *No project could be found with key 'screens'.*
h3. Expected Results

It should return to the *project-config/screens* without shown this error.
h3. Actual Results

When we click on the *cancel*, instead of back to the *project-config/screens* appear an error. 

*Video with error*: [Click here to access the video.|https://share.getcloudapp.com/geuwPn27]

When we click on the *cancel* occurs this GET: *https://<instance>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/project-config//screens*

*Note:* into this GET URL we have an empty space where should have the project key.

To solve this we need insert the project key into *project-config/<PROJECT_KEY>/screens.*
h3. Workaround

Back to *project-config/<project_key>/screens* through browser option.
fields.summary: Cancel action on the Issue Type Screen Scheme Association returns an error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When logging time with Time Tracking, the work log entry is showing a past entry rather than current. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue
 # go to Time Tracking and log two hours as an example
→ you will notice that Date/Time started: is 2 hours behind. This is expected as the work was done in the past.
# go to Activity > Work Log 
→ check log entry

h3. Expected Results

<User> Logged 2h 1 minute ago

h3. Actual Results
<User> Logged 2h *2 hours ago*

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When logging time with Time Tracking, the work log entry is showing a past entry rather than current.

fields.description:
Created from this Developer's Community issue -  - [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/webpanel-not-visible-after-expanding-it-in-issue-right-context-old-issue-view/39479/3]

*Steps to reproduce*
90% reproducible with simple atlassian-connect.json and index.html (see below).
Disable “New Jira issue view” in personal settings and follow the steps:
 # Say we have a field Text Right Content,  collapse “Text Right Content” clicking it to get “*>* Text Right Content”
 # Press F5 to refresh the page
 # Expand “Text Right Content” clicking it to get “*\/* Text Right Content”
 # “Text value” is not visible.
fields.summary: Web panel content is not visible after navigating to issue and expanding it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Change in assignee record is not seen in issue history
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a post-function *Assign the issue to the current user/ Set resolution* to the transition 
 # Add a screen to this transition with the Assignee/Resolution field.
 # Publish workflow
 # Create Issue
 # Transition the status from *To-do* to *In-Progress*, update the Assignee/Resolution on the transition screen
 # Check issue history, it doesn't show any records for the assignment of the issue or the resolution being set.

h3. Expected Results

Show the record, Unassigned-> Username or Resolution Set.

!Screenshot 2020-07-01 at 7.16.02 PM.png|width=391,height=113!
h3. Actual Results

The record is missing from the issue history. This affects the SLA stop condition leading the SLAs to continue running on the issues
h3. Workaround

Remove the screen or the post function in the workflow.
fields.summary: Settings the assignee or resolution twice is not seen in issue history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Filters you own may not show as being owned by you.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple filters (more than 2)
 # Favourite each filter
 # Go to filters from the main nav
 # Click on one filter - verify that under details it shows it is owned by you
 # Now click the next filter. Verify the owner under details. It will not show it is owned by you.
 # Refresh the page - now the filter should show as being owned by you

h3. Expected Results

You have permission to modify all your filters without needing to refresh
h3. Actual Results

Subsequent clicks lose the owner information.
h3. Workaround

If this happens, reload the page when the filter you want to edit is shown. The owner information is restored.
fields.summary: Clicking through multiple filters you own can show subsequent filters not to be owned by you

fields.description:
A user reported that they are basing Swimlanes on Epics, and have a quick filter to show only sub-tasks on the board.

When the "Only Subtasks" filter is enabled, the Epic Swimlanes disappear, and they are only left with the subtasks

 

!_JST-584781__Kanban_board_doesn_t_show_swimlane__epic__when_assignee_is_selected_-_Atlassian_Support_System.png|width=393,height=148!

What they would like to see by default, is that when you are basing Swimlanes on Epics, that you can then filter those issues and have them still organized under the Epic Swimlanes.

The user found a workaround where they based Swimlanes on Queries (which query relevant Epics), and then were able to quick filter without losing the Swimlanes.

Ideally these Swimlanes based on Epics would remain even when using an additional quick filter.
fields.summary: Default option to quick filter issues on board with Swimlanes based on Epics

fields.description: We're currently using the "/issue/createmeta" endpoint, but it has some serious performance issues for instances with a lot of projects, since it's not paginated. It'd be great to be able to use the paginated API (/rest/api/3/project/search) with an "action" similar to the "issue/createmeta" endpoint.
fields.summary: Add "createissue" action to /rest/api/3/project/search endpoint

fields.description:
When using the backlog for Kanban board, it would be great to see the parent of sub-tasks above it, even though they're on different statuses. From a UI/UX perspective, the actual behavior is really confusing.
h3. If the parent and sub-tasks are on the same status

!image-2020-07-06-14-33-13-927.png|width=700,height=284!
h3. If they are on the different statuses

Even though there is a text saying what issue is the parent for that sub-task, the visualization can get really frustrating for users:

!image-2020-07-06-14-42-31-391.png|width=699,height=279!
fields.summary: Improve sub-task visualization on Backlog for Kanban

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Use a different Issue type Scheme on Classic projects shows an incorrect number of issues on the screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your Project Settings
 # Go to Issue Types
 # Click on Actions
 # Use a different Scheme

!image-2020-07-06-13-06-14-743.png|width=700,height=150!
h3. Expected Results

The next screen should show how many issues are on this project.
h3. Actual Results

The next screen shows: *"There are 0 issues in the project."*
 !image-2020-07-06-13-04-59-036.png|width=701,height=278!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Use a different Issue type Scheme shows an incorrect number of issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Running a JQL with the function *projectsLeadByUser()* returns an error (status 400 in browser console) if one of the projects is in the Trash:
{code}
A value provided by the function 'projectsLeadByUser' is invalid for the field 'project'.
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Add issues to it
 # Ensure you are the Project lead
 # Move the project to Trash
 # Run a JQL with the same user like:
{code}
project in projectsLeadByUser()
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Project should not be returned in the results as it's in the Trash and content is unaccessible, however, this shouldn't prevent other projects content to be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Error is displayed:
{code}
A value provided by the function 'projectsLeadByUser' is invalid for the field 'project'.
{code}

h3. Workaround
* Permanently delete the projects from the Trash list that are causing the issue (the ones that the affected user is the project lead associated with it)
* Restore all the projects you are the lead of from the Trash to be able to perform the search, but please keep in mind that this will make the project accessible according to the permission scheme associated with it.
* Alternatively, you can have a dummy user to set as project lead to projects to be marked as deleted, but not sure if this would be a feasible option to everyone.
fields.summary: JQL with projectsLeadByUser() returns an error if one of the projects is in the Trash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *updatedBy* function only works with actives users, if I disabled a user and use this function, it doesn't bring the correct result. However, the *status changed* query works and pull out the information made by the disabled user. The query that I'm using for *updatedBY* is:
{code:java}
issuekey in updatedBy("<username>") order by created DESC{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issues with a user
 # Disable the user that create the issue.
 # User the query: 
{code:java}
 issuekey in updatedBy("<username>") order by created DESC   {code}

h3. Expected Results

Since the *updatedBy* pull out the issues created by a user, the expected result is to those issues be shown after I used this function.
h3. Actual Results

No issues were shown since the user is disabled.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Be able to user UptadedBy function with disabled users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a wiki default value has been configured on a multiline field in a classic project, returning this value from the call to POST /rest/api/\{2:3}/issue/createmeta is currently not supported.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic project.
 # Configure a multiline custom field to be added to all issues of a particular type in the project (e.g. always added to screens where the issue is a task).
 # Add a default value to this multiline custom field.
 # Call  /rest/api/2/issue/createmeta or  /rest/api/3/issue/createmeta 

h3. Expected Results

The response shows that the multiline custom field has a default value and returns in the default value in wiki for v2 requests and ADF for v3 requests.
h3. Actual Results

A response is returned that states the field has a default value, however this value is not returned for either version of the API.
h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround for classic projects. This should work if the issue was created in a next-gen project.
fields.summary: Calling /createmeta does not return a value for multiline custom fields in wiki

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently in classic projects, multiline custom field default values are stored in wiki. When doing issue updates, we assume calls through the v2 API means all rich text we're handling is in wiki, and similar for v3 APIs correlating with ADF.

This results in a bug where a wiki default value is silently discarded if issue creates are performed via the v3 API.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic project.
 # Configure a multiline custom field to be added to all issues of a particular type in the project (e.g. always added to screens where the issue is a task).
 # Add a default value to this multiline custom field.
 # Create an issue of said type using POST /rest/3/api/issue
 # Open the created issue in the issue view.

h3. Expected Results

The issue is created and the default value renders in ADF in the new issue view or wikimarkup in the old issue view.
h3. Actual Results

The issue is created but no default value is present.
h3. Workaround

Create issues using the v2 API.
fields.summary: Creating an issue using the v3 API should save with the wiki default values

fields.description: Since there is limit in the automation for jira, it would be great if the rule execution does not count towards the usage and only evaluation has been done.
fields.summary: Automation usage should not be counted if the rule is not executed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While adding groups to the project role, space has been added after selecting the group

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
Navigate to project role and select the group picker

 # Step 2
After adding the group, additional space is added between groups.

 !image-2020-07-04-23-25-01-730.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

No space should be there between group

h3. Actual Results

Space added between groups


h3. Workaround

Remove spaces manually between groups
fields.summary: Unable to add default groups to projects role due to spaces added between group names

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, when a comment was not saved, the only way to see that is by going directly to the ticket.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add a third tab on the Notifications' panel showing the tickets that have unsaved comments for the current user.
fields.summary: Ability to see all unsaved comments

fields.description: When you delete or archive a project, this action triggers a notification for all Jira admins in the site. Have an option to set when trigger them or even disable these email notifications to admins in the UI would be very helpful for admins that don't want to send this to other users.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to customize delete/archive notifications from projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Smart links to Confluence pages do not render correctly
* Instead of a preview containing the Confluence page title, users will see "You don't have access to this link".  Example, the link to "Test page" is rendered correctly:
 !Screenshot 2020-07-03 at 17.35.07.png|thumbnail! 
* The link is not broken - redirection to the correct URL works when clicked, the issue is cosmetic

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create comments/issue Descriptions that contain smart links
 # Change the site name i.e. site-name1.atlassian.net > site-name2.atlassian.net

h3. Expected Results
* The smart link is rendered correctly, showing the title of the Confluence page

h3. Actual Results
* The link label shows "You don't have access to this link"

h3. Workaround
* Edit the field/comment and recreate the link with the current URL of the Confluence page
fields.summary: Site rename: "Smart link" labels for Confluence links do not render correctly after a site rename

fields.description:
Currently Cascading custom field can be imported via External system import option. Please update the document https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/create-issues-using-the-csv-importer/ to mention the same. 
There is a public Bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64747 which was closed as wont fix. However the workaround mentioned is to use External system import option. 

Please update the document to reflect the same.Thanks.
fields.summary: Update the documentation for CSV import of cascading custom field

fields.description:
Currently we do not have a notification schedule for Jira Cloud Bot in slack like the workspace wide settings as below : 
!image-2020-07-03-19-11-50-838.png|thumbnail! 

It would be really helpful, if we can set a notification schedule/settings for the Jira cloud bot in specific.
fields.summary: Notification schedule settings for Jira Cloud Bot in Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to create a new Jira Software project using the Procurement Template, the user receives error
{noformat}
Project not created, for some reason the magic didn't happen...
{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Custom Field called "Vendor" in a next-gen project
 # Create new project using Procurement template
 # Click create - Error will appear in the UI

Note that the error only occurs if there is a next-gen Custom Field called "Vendor", and Custom Field "Vendor" does not already exist as a system field.
h3. Expected Results

Expected is the project would be created without issues, even if the next-gen field named "Vendor" already exists
h3. Actual Results

After clicking on Create, an error dialog appears in the bottom right corner
{noformat}
Project not created, for some reason the magic didn't happen...
{noformat}


h3. Workaround

Successful workaround was for the customer to rename the next-gen Custom Field "Vendor" to a different name, and then the project could successfully be created. The same workaround was successfully tested internally.
fields.summary: Unable to create project using Procurement template when next-gen custom field named "Vendor" exists (appears in other languages as well)

fields.description:
As mentioned on the issue https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72346, on the new Media viewer, the decision was made to only request videos at a lower size/quality, to load faster for the end-user and improve performance, and the user can download the image/video to see it in the full size.

So, when using the *New Issue View* and clicking in one attached video, the browser is using the endpoint '/file/<cloud_id>/artifact/<videoname>' to get the video, instead of the endpoint '/secure/attachment/<attachment_id>/<videoname>?stream=true' used on the +Old Issue View+.

h3. Basic video comparison
h4. New Issue View:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Old Issue View:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

(i) Depending on the video size/dimensions the quality can get worst.

h3. Suggestion for Improvement
It would be nice to have a higher quality preview to the user because downloading the video is definitely not a good workaround.

h3. Why is this important
Video can be a very important part of the documentation for some users. For example, when showing some specific behavior related to their application.
fields.summary: Improve video quality for New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we open the link to a specific comment, if the comment is collapsed, it only opens the regular issue view, the comment is not focused.

The ability to link to a specific comment when using the new issue view was implemented on 06 May 2020 according to the improvement request JRACLOUD-70156.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira issue with 20+ comments.
 # Copy the link of a collapsed comment.
 # Open the link in a new tab.
 # If the comment is collapsed, it will open the regular issue view, the comment will not be focused.

h3. Expected Results

When we open the link of a collapsed comment, we just see the regular issue view, the comment is not focused.
h3. Actual Results

When we open the link of a collapsed comment, the comment should be expanded and focused.
h3. Workaround

Use the Old Jira Issue View or expand the collapsed comment.
fields.summary: New issue view - link to a specific comment collapsed just opens the regular issue view, the comment is not focused.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Entity properties allow apps to add key/value stores to Jira entities such as issues or projects, or to your Connect app itself (see [Entity properties|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-entity-properties/]).

Some users might want to use those properties as criteria for filtering/reporting on issues.

Currently, it is possible to create them via REST API, but that might be an additional step, specially for users do not keep their creation of issues via REST API (e.g. but via JSON import).

h3. Suggestion

Provide the ability of importing entity properties via JSON.
fields.summary: Ability to import entity properties via JSON

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Assignee icon disappears from parent of sub-task on Next-gen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue on Next-gen
 # Create sub-tasks below this issue
 # Assign the sub-tasks to someone
 # Go to the parent
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

!image-2020-07-02-10-14-24-001.png|width=601,height=328!
h3. Actual Results

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail|width=601,height=328!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Assignee icon disappears from parent of sub-task on Next-gen

fields.description:
Currently when accessing Jira in new navigation, it takes directly to a previously visited dashboard. 

In this case, user has to click on three dots and then click on *view all dashboards* to view the list of all dashboards. 

User should be navigated to the view all dashboards directly.
fields.summary: Option to change the landing page to dashboard in Jira Cloud.

fields.description:
Hi!
I want to show board on a wall screen, so there i would like to see more important information, cards and etc.
But now half of the screen used for search, filters and unnecessary info.
Please add an ability to switch view to fullscreen mode without topbar, sidebar and filters. Just a board
fields.summary: Fullscreen mode for board view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The REST API /rest/api/3/user/columns ignores the accountId parameter, and always returns the columns for the current user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Request /rest/api/3/user/columns - you see the columns for your user
 # Find an account ID of another user (e.g. abcde-12345)
 # Request /rest/api/3/user/columns?accountId=abcde-12345 - you still see the columns for your user

h3. Expected Results

For step 3, you should see the default columns for the user with the account ID abcde-12345.
h3. Actual Results

You always see the default columns for your user.
h3. Workaround

If you supply a value for the username parameter (any value) as well as the accountId parameter, the accountId parameter works.

e.g. /rest/api/3/user/columns?accountId=abcde=12345&username=anything
fields.summary: Get user default columns API ignores accountId param

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After deleting and reactivating Jira on a cloud site old activity remains from the previous Confluence. It's not getting cleared out as expected. Clicking on any of the links results in errors.

h3. Environment

 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Use a cloud instance with Jira and Confluence (I have JSW, JSD & Core)
 # Log into Jira - you're taken through onboarding to create a project. I created 'Test' project.
 # Go to site admin Billing > Manage subscriptions
 # Delete Jira (select 3 dots and type DELETE, click Other then Delete)
 # Wait 5 minutes
 # Go to site admin Discover applications
 # For Jira, click Reactivate, click Start trial
 # Close the dialog, don't go to Jira yet
 # Wait 5 minutes 
 # Go to Jira
 # The onboarding screens appear you create a new project
 # On the "your work" tab you see previous issues and projects that don't exist anymore.
 # If you click in the issues or projects, it says "We couldn't connect to that issue"

h3. Expected Results

I expected Jira to be cleaned out and like a new instance with no data.

h3. Actual Results

There is cached information from the previous installation stored somewhere, which can lead to some pretty nasty results (data leakage depending on how you are using the instance).

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

*Note*

Even after running a blank Jira backup to wipe everything the Your Work page loads events from past.
fields.summary: After deleting and reactivating Jira old activity remains

fields.description:
Ideally, on a user story type, Jira should have a voting system for story points. More often I see everyone putting story points in chat section. A voting system also gives you analysis on the estimation patterns, too. 

Would be useful in sprint planning/sizing meetings (pre estimation metrics in T-shirt size for leads could be an add on).
 
Much needed now when teams are remote! We cant show those SP number boards anymore. It also ensures that everyone has to have the story open and go through it effectively.
fields.summary: Implement a voting system for story points

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary


When email notifications for changes in assignee are sent out in text formatting, the usernames of the current and previous assignee are left blank.

This behavior does not occur when using HTML formatting.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1.) Set email notification format to text
2.) Change issue assignee from one user to another
3.) Check the email notification
4.) Notice the usernames of previous and current assignee are blank
h3. Expected Results

Assignee:<current_assignee> (was:<previous_assignee>)
h3. Actual Results

Assignee: (was: )
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Email notifications in text format showing assignee usernames as blanks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the Project's notification email address is changed, internal Jira users will not be able to reply to Jira notifications

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to any Jira project > Project settings > Notifications.
# Change the notification address to anything other than the default one. Example: project@site.atlassian.net
# Trigger a Jira issue notification to yourself.
# Reply to the notification. Notice that the reply will be sent to whatever you've set in the notification scheme, instead of jira@site.atlassian.net (Jira's default incoming mail address)
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Your email is added as a comment on the ticket.

h3. Actual Results

Your reply will fail and a bounce message will be received.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

- Jira should be adding its default address (jira@<site>.atlassian.net) as *reply-to* in the notification email header.
- This completely invalidates the following KB: [Configuring Jira to send emails on behalf of your domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-979428371.html]

h3. Workaround

There's no workaround other than using Jira's default email (jira@<site>.atlassian.net) as the notification address.
fields.summary: Unable to reply to Jira emails if project's notification address was changed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a comment have "[]" symbol before mention syntax , the symbol being replaced with mention syntax and removed the text in the middle of the symbol and the syntax. This issue happen in at the old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment with the text below :-
{noformat}
Hello [] , developer team.
I would like to mention this user [Nur Atiqah Roslan|~accountid:557057:1a8aeee5-40e9-413a-9f4e-2f074f09644a]
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The comment should look like below :-
 !Screenshot 2020-07-01 at 9.59.25 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The comment added as below :-
 !Screenshot 2020-07-01 at 10.00.23 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Use the new issue view to add the comment ; OR
* Add backslash at the symbol :-
{noformat}
\[\]
{noformat}
fields.summary: When a comment have "[]" symbol before mention syntax , the symbol being replaced with mention syntax and removed the text in the middle of the symbol and the syntax

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Error is reported in a new issue view while attaching Excel(xlsx) file having read passwords using the uploader option (Attach > Save).  The file is attached successfully with the Drag and drop option. And the same process works fine in old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any issue key in the new issue view. Like below
 !problem.png|thumbnail! 
 # Click on *Attach*  
 # Select any xlsx file having read password
 # Click save

h3. Expected Results

The file should be attached to the issue.

h3. Actual Results

The below error is thrown in while attaching this file.

 !Error while upload.png|thumbnail! 

Additional information - "There was an error while uploading a file"

h3. Workaround

The current workaround is to either use the old issue view or use drag & drop option to attach the file to issue.
fields.summary: New issue view fail Excel (xlsx) file having read password

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation for Jira not available on the Cloud sites, where the site was restored with a server or Cloud back up
h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a test Cloud site 
* Make sure the site has Jira Service desk ( in Standard/Premium plan)
* Restore a Cloud back up taken from another Cloud site, which has Jira service desk and Automation for Jira installed
* Go to a Service desk project --> Project Settings
* Automation tab will be missing.


h3. Actual Results
* Go to a Service desk project --> Project Settings
* Automation tab will be missing.

Also, Go to 
* System Manage apps
* Select all Apps
* We observe that Automation for Jira app is not installed by default


h3. Expected Results
* Go to a Service desk project --> Project Settings
* Automation tab will be available.

Also, Automation for Jira app should be installed by default

h3. Workaround
* Ensure there is a default group for all your Jira applications, specially Jira Service Management.
* Reach out to Atlassian support to enable the application.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira not available on the Cloud sites, when the site is restored with a server or Cloud back up

fields.description:
Currently when adding a post function: "Update Issue Field" to Create Transaction - it is automatically added before "Creates the issue originally". This results in the post function not to be fired. For example - if setting an assignee - it does not update the assignee field upon issue creation.

Current workaround: the post function "Update issue field" should be manually moved to be before "Creates the issue originally" 

Suggestion:
* "Update Issue Field" post function to be created prior to "Creates the issue originally"
* Or - Alert to warn the user if there are any Post Functions that are not ordered correctly
fields.summary: Alert on "Update Issue Field" post function position when placed before "Create issue originally."

fields.description:
As per the documentation https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/ . The current limit on webhooks is 100 webhooks per app per tenant. 

It would be great if this limit can be made configurable.
fields.summary: Please add the ability to increase webhook limit in cloud

fields.description: Availability to rename all Application Links (Bitbucket, Fisheye, etc) from the Application Navigator menu.
fields.summary: Availability to rename/edit all Application Links (Bitbucket, Fisheye, etc) and favicon/logo from the Application Navigator menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As in Advanced Searching, users are able to search for Worklog components such as WorklogAuthor, Worklogdate and so on. However, these fields are not able to be added as a column in List View. We would like the feature to do this for better reporting of user's worklog per day / issue.
fields.summary: Ability to add Worklog components as columns when viewing results with 'List View'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Description field from Jira Cloud (Android) not showing data
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue on Jira Cloud Mobile on Android device

h3. Expected Results
The description field should show the data of the issue
h3. Actual Results
The description field is shown grey-out and with no data

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Description field from Jira Cloud (Android) not showing data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to clone an existing project role in next gen without a Jira Software license fails.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure your site is not licensed to use Jira Software projects (eg: either or both of Jira Core or Jira Service Desk)
 # Navigate to the {{/jira/servicedesk/projects/<projectkey>/settings/access}} url in a NG project ("Internal Acess")(swap {{servicedesk}} for {{core}} depending on your project type)
 # Click "Manage Roles"
 # Duplicate the "Administrator" role and attempt to save

h3. Expected Results

The role should be successfully duplicated.
h3. Actual Results

An error flag appears in the bottom left corner saying: "Error. Something went wrong". 
 Also includes a 400 response in the network tab of the browser.
h3. Workaround

Creating a new role manually with all of the permissions required manually seems to work.
fields.summary: Trying to clone an existing project role in next gen without Jira Software license fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachments containing special characters in the title will not upload

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach any file with a special character on the name e.g. Test/Image.png

h3. Expected Results

The file should get attached or show a message indicating that it contains invalid characters

h3. Actual Results

The file does not get attached and shows a message indicating to Reload the issue and try again:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attachments containing special characters in the title will not upload

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Issue Calendar gadget does not work with Advanced Roadmaps fields:
* Target start
* Target end

It returns the following error:
{code}
An error occurred while the search used to generate this issue calendar was being executed. 
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Gadget *Jira Issue Calendar* to a Jira Dashboard
# Select one of the Advanced Roadmaps fields (Target start, Target end) as *Date to Display*

h3. Expected Results
The macro should display the information correctly

h3. Actual Results
Jira displays an error:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-25 at 11.43.27 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira issues calendar gadget does not work with Advanced Roadmaps fields

fields.description:
Sometimes users have multiple statuses under the same category and would be nice if we had the option to filter such actions based on the statuses categories instead of the status itself individually.

Eg. Whenever a ticket is transitioned to a done status category then do something in my automation rule.

So wherever someone adds a new status or edit its category it would not break the automation.
fields.summary: Add support for status category to 'Issue transitioned' trigger

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

'Assigned to me' filter in the JIRA core boards isn't working for all users. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a business project
2. Create a new task in the business project and assign it to yourself
3. Create a new task in the business project and let it unassigned
4. Click on 'Assigned to me' filter
h3. Expected Results

User should be able to see all the tasks assigned to him/her in the board.
h3. Actual Results

User is not be able to see the new task assigned to him/her. It shows the unassigned issues.

h3. Workaround
Search your name in the filter box or refresh the page as the issue state is (incorrectly) held in the frontend until reload.
fields.summary: 'Assigned to me' filter in the JIRA coreboards isn't working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, admins are not notified when third-party apps are installed or deleted from their Jira instance.

That can be an important notification, specially when the app that was installed can somehow modify issues or project settings, or even add to the total billing.

h3. Suggestion

Add the option to admins so they can decide whether or not to be notified about third-party apps' installation.
fields.summary: Ability to configure notifications for when third-party apps are installed or deleted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the full page JSD issue view, entering lengthy comment content into the comment field causes the field to expand up the page, obscuring the comment history.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new JSD issue
# Add several comments such that the issue requires scrolling to view the expanded comment history
# Enter a new comment with lengthy text including carriage returns

h3. Expected Results
Comment field expands down the issue view leaving the comment history visible upon scrolling back up the page.

h3. Actual Results
Comment fields expands up the page obscuring the comment history and making viewing the existing issue details difficult.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Long Comment Content Expands Field Obscuring Comment History

fields.description: The "Work Description" text box in the work log window of the new issue view is too narrow and needs to be widened.  Compared to the wider text box in the old issue view, this narrow and mobile-centric text box is more difficult to write and read text.  It also requires more scrolling and makes creating a table with more than 3 columns difficult.
fields.summary: Widen text box in work log window for new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you link a Jira Project to a Confluence Space, you are able to create pages directly from Jira, on the *Pages* section. However, the Blank page option or clicking on *+77 more* (the number may depend on how many templates you have on Confluence) are not working as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Project which is connected to a Confluence Space.
# Click on *Pages*, on the sidebar.
# Click on *Blank page*, or on *+77 more*.
# You are redirected to the create dialog on Confluence. Choose any template on it.
# Click on *Create* button.


h3. Expected Results
The user should be redirected to the editor, with the content loaded according to the template selected.

h3. Actual Results
The draft page is created, but you are not redirected to it.

*Notes*:
* Selecting the templates *Meeting Notes* or *Retrospectives* directly from JIRA work fine - it seems that due to the fact the endpoint doesn't redirect you to within the space, we are able to create the pages.

h3. Workaround
* If you click on *Close* on the create dialog, and then on *Create* on Confluence navigation top bar, you'll be able to create the page accordingly
*OR*
* You can close the creating dialog and navigate on the topbar to *Recent > Drafts* and select the latest draft page (it is the one you just tried to create).
fields.summary: Create Confluence page from Jira not working for all templates

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to automate or make changes to the issue layout using the REST API.

I would like to propose exposing the Jira Issue layout configuration for the new issue view via the Jira Cloud REST API.
fields.summary: Expose Project Issue layout for new issue view via the REST API

fields.description:
It would be awesome if the project avatar after uploading it would be retained. Currently, the file isn't retained and it doesn't keep in the repository of avatar images.

 !projectAvatar.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Retain uploaded project avatar image

fields.description: Add Brave Browser Support for Jira, which is  Chromium-based so it will render Jira as Google Chrome does.
fields.summary: Add Brave Browser Support for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Sending a POST request to the */rest/api/3/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/notify* REST API endpoint returns status code 500 (Internal Server Error) instead of 400 (Bad Request) in case of errors in the request body. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Send a POST REST API request to the with below body to the issue notify endpoint *https://SITENAME.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/ISSUE-KEY/notify* {code:java} { "subject": "Test Email", "textBody": "Body", "htmlBody": "

Body

", "to": { "voters": false, "assignee": true, "watchers": false, "reporter": true } } {code} # See that the request works fine (returning status code 204) and that assignee and reporter of the issue having key  ISSUE-KEY receive a notification as expected. # Now send below (wrong) body to the same endpoint: {code:java} { "subject": "Test Email", "textBody": "Body", "htmlBody": "

Body

", "to": { "voters": false, "assignee": false, "watchers": false, "reporter": false, "groups": null } } {code} h3. Expected Results Status code 400 (Bad request) is returned h3. Actual Results Status code 500 (Internal Server Error) is returned instead h3. Workaround No workaround available at the moment.
fields.summary: The notify rest api endpoint returns status code 500 instead of 400 if there are errors in the request body

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Target End in a JQL with a specific value it returns an error but using it with a function it works 
Working:
"Target end" = startOfYear()
Not Working
"Target end" > "2020-01-01"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run the query "Target end" > "2020-01-01" in advanced search

h3. Expected Results
To return a value 

h3. Actual Results

Returns the error {"errorMessages":["jqlTooComplex"],"errors":{}}

 !image-2020-06-17-14-32-37-817.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use a function like "Target end" = startOfYear()
fields.summary: Target End field JQL return an error when using in this form: "Target end" > "2020-01-01"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When assigning an issue, the assignee value is not displayed in the "Issue Assigned" notification

!Screenshot 2020-06-26 at 9.16.40 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Change the "E-mail from" settings in General configuration to the following:
{code:java}
(JIRA) ${fullname}{code}
!image-2020-07-24-18-33-31-013.png|width=316,height=107!
 2) Assign an issue to a user
 3) Access the "Issue Assigned" notification you've received (your user needs to be listed on the Notification scheme of the project and for this event)
 4) The Assignee will be blank on notification message

This happens because Jira uses an old template notification since the new template is not supported by the configuration above.

However, when the _E-mail from_ setting is configured with Jira default setting (shown below), the Assignee value is shown on the message
{code:java}
${fullname} (Jira){code}
This happens because in this case Jira will use the new notification template:

!NewTemplate.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Assignee value should be displayed in the notification even though the old template is being used.
h3. Actual Results

Assignee value is not displayed in the notification
h3. Workaround

On Email from setting inside General Configuration, use the Jira default value, that is:
{code:java}
${fullname} (Jira)
{code}
.
fields.summary: Assigning an issue notification does not display the assignee value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the "Copy Value From Other Field" post function to copy the "Priority" value from parent issue to sub-task it doesn't work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a post-function "Copy Value From Other Field" at "Create" transition
 # Then, set up as per screenshot below :-
 !Screenshot 2020-06-26 at 2.48.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish the workflow
# Then, create a sub task issue.

h3. Expected Results
The subtask priority updated with the same priority value from the parent issue.

h3. Actual Results
The priority field at subtask issue doesn't updated.

h3. Workaround
Use the "project automation" feature to update the value.
fields.summary: The "Copy Value From Other Field" post function doesn't work on "Create" transition for "Priority" field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For filter that use history searches (changed, was, etc.), some instances may results in long times of processing and even "500 - Internal Server Error" errors due to time outs in the database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*This bug happens on instances with large number of history items in tickets, won't be reproducible in just any environment*

# Access the filter having query as mentioned below:
{code}
project = ABC AND  assignee != currentUser() AND assignee was currentUser() ORDER BY updated DESC
{code}
# I have attached the error appears while accessing the filter


h3. Expected Results
The filter should load without any issues.

h3. Actual Results
The filter is throwing "500 - Internal Server Error"

h3. Workaround
On refreshing the page, filter loads successfully.
fields.summary: Large number of history items may cause "500 - Internal Server Error" in filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating an issue (task, story, bug, etc...) the post Function - "Copy value from other field - Copy from parent" it will add value from the last issue created when it should not copy any data.

This case was tested with field "Labels"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue type Task
 # Go to other project and create an issue type task and it will add the label from the first created issue

h3. Expected Results
As the description says if the issue is not a sub-task, no data is should be copied

h3. Actual Results
It is adding Labels from the first created issue, even when the new issue created is not a sub-task

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Post Function - Copy value from other field - not working correctly

fields.description:
Once you have some extra fields set to the issue screen, you may have a lot of free space below the comments section, like the example below:

 !image-2020-06-25-19-56-10-672.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Waste of space on New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The warning message that says I_ssue updates available! This issue was just updated by an automation rule._ Please reload to see the latest changes is not being shown when using the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Build an Automation rule with any trigger except Manual trigger
 # Run the rule using the new issue view
 # Run again the rule using the old issue view

h3. Expected Results

The warning message should appear in both views.
h3. Actual Results

The message is shown only when using the old issue view. For the new issue view, the message is only shown when using the Manual trigger into Automation rule.

https://share.getcloudapp.com/rRulWLx5
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for the new issue view.
fields.summary: Warning that says "This issue was just updated by an automation rule" does not appear in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Running a jql search for *Participant of an issue* type custom field returns 500 response from server if the value does not exist

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field *participants* of type *Participant of an issue* and add it to the screen
# Try to search for issues from the issues using the following jql:
Do not enter a valid email address
{noformat}
"Request participants" = "Invalidemailaddress@abc.com"
"participants" = "Invalidemailaddress@abc.co"
{noformat} 

h3. Expected Results
The jql will report the following error with response code 400
{quote}
The value 'Invalidemailaddress@abc.co' does not exist for the field 'Request participants'.
The value 'Invalidemailaddress@abc.co' does not exist for the field 'participants'.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
This works as expected for the *Request participant* or any other user picker field like reporter or assignee.

However, for the participants filed the jql returns a 500 response code and the following error:
{quote}
An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search.
{quote}

h3.Workaround
We do not have a workaround as of now.
fields.summary: Running a jql search for Participant of an issue type custom field returns 500 response if the value does not exist
